content.description: On the lower left portion of the South Face and to the left of a big left-facing, left-leaning corner, climb a right-facing flake, then move right under a roof.

climbs.name: Mortal Thoughts
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Woody Stark, Wendall Smith, Karen Bohl, others

content.description: This excellent and challenging route is located on the steep slab below Dream of Redrocks.  A few bolts lead to a think crack and then to a 2 bolt anchor on top of the slab.
content.protection: QDs for the bolts, there might be a fixed pin, and then thin to medium small for the crack section.
content.location: Located just below the climb Dream of Red Rocks.

content.description: Climbs the slab/arete right 10 feet right of Dreams of Red Rocks. Â Set up TR from the rings between Dreams of Red Rocks and Little Brown Jug. You could have a bit of a pendulum, but we did it without adding a directional
content.protection: Have to lead one of the other trad routes then set up TR from rap rings on the ledge 3/4 the way up Little Brown Jug and Dreams of Red Rocks

content.description: This climbs an obvious left-facing corner/crack system on the brown rock of the  upper right side of the west face.

climbs.name: Little Bit Of Magic, A
climbs.fa: Roger Linfield and Dennis Yates, Dec. 1986

content.description: A steep, moderate, knobby section leads to the overhanging crux.  An interesting variety of moves takes you up to easier going and the top.
content.location: This climb starts high on the south face, a bit left of the upper part of Dreams Of Red Rocks.  It follows an obvious crack on the prow of the wall.

climbs.name: Gourmet Sausage
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Don Reid, Tucker Tech, Maggie Ross,  Uri

content.description: This route climbs the wiener shaped pillar to the right of Tail Gunner.
content.location: In the Pernicious Dome Area of the N. Wonderland.

content.description: This climb is located on a separate formation NW of Pernicious Dome. The route faces SW. Bartlett couldn't find it, Vogel didn't put it in J T West. See if you can find it. It's a cool crack climb on a white face of rock that faces SW. It's the only route on the formation, and it's a striking line. It sits up sort of high, so it's not really hidden. It does exist.

A few feet right of "Little Brown Jug", climb up to and follow a left-leaning crack, then thin cracks to the top.

Standard rack.
